data.message: Em you suit your style this LL style you been trying to spit with lately is hard to vibe to lyrically its forced and all over the place bring yourself back.

replies.message: Was just about to comment. Cheers Tommy Brangwynne
Eminem himself stated he was going back in to the Era of LL beasty boys on his new stuff etc. If you cant see the similarities your not an Em fan.
Look at his iggy diss, you could almost say that its not Em

I think it's all good. He said in an interview on the bonus dvd for The Eminem Show that he believed as an artist you should always be ever-evolving. He said that if you sound the same on your next album as you did on your last album, then you're failing as an artist. I think Em has stayed true to his words. He doesn't really sound or rap exactly the same on any two albums, with the exception of Encore and Curtain Call, and Curtain Call doesn't really count. I think MMLP2 was just such a big leap from what he was on Recovery that it was a little hard to swallow, but the more i listen to it the more i appreciate what he did with it. I pretty much only listen to Eminem, and it feels like i'm listening to 8 different artists.

Jared Welch I agree I didn't like mmlp 2 when I first heard it. He's said himself "Then called the Slim Shady LP the greatest The Marshall Mathers was a classic, the Eminem Show was fantastic But Encore just didn't have the caliber to match it. I guess enough time just ain't past yet. A few more years that shit will be illmatic."
Yeah tell him how to rap! You obviously know better.. 😃
fucken right. let em do his thing he made it..so who the fuck are you to tell him to.come back to his original shit
if you can't hear what he's saying then you weren't listening buddy
You look about as hip hop as lady gaga
I have hard of hearing, I can still follow his lyrics when he spits on his new shit, I dunno what the hell youre saying.
